relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Those undecided, struggling with money, or like smaller colleges.
Saves you a lot of money compared to other colleges in Ohio.
I liked it because it was smaller and the class sizes were smaller too. I felt like I could get the attention I needed. Many of the teachers however seemed to not care much about students.
pageTitle: Cincinnati State Technical and Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {67478=I have only been at Cincinnati State since August of 2012 and so far I feel that I am getting a good education. I just finished the fall semester and I believe I am in a good place for higher learning., 22833=I began taking classes in February of this year. My experience so far has been great. I enjoy the atmosphere of the campus, the instructors and the class size. I feel more 1 on 1 with the instructors because of the class sizes. I have really enjoyed myself this term and I am looking forward to the following terms., 115043=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 55552=I started to attend at Cincinnati state in 2007 and the school appeared as a you get what you pay for type of environment except the culinary school section was the only nice part. Going back to campus in 2012 they improved the main building. They also improved with the newer parking spaces.}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Will learn a lot My grandmother attended there for sign language classes because she founded out that i was hearing impaired. I went to the classes with her and i said the school couldn't be better than any other small community collage in Cincinnati! Login to rate or flag the reviews Tanisha from Cincinnati, OH 01/14/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 1 out of 2 people found this review useful. 4 of 33 Categories Comments Tips for prospective students Know your major before coming to the school, meet with your academic advisors a MUST otherwise you'll take plenty of pointless classes. Bang for the buck It's a pretty inexpensive school, again I dont know about the other fields because my major is education, but I dont believe I am getting the education I am paying for. Am enjoying being here
